title: Ovechkin scores No. 889, now 6 from NHL record
content: Washington captain Alex Ovechkin scored the 889th goal of his career to move six goals away from breaking Wayne Gretzky's NHL record, and helped the Capitals to a point before the Winnipeg Jets rallied in overtime to secure a 3-2 victory on Tuesday night.

title: Lillard out indefinitely due to blood clot in calf
content: Bucks guard Damian Lillard has been diagnosed with deep vein thrombosis in his right calf and is out indefinitely.

title: Sources: QB Wilson, Giants agree to 1-year deal
content: The Giants and free agent QB Russell Wilson reached agreement on a one-year deal worth up to $21 million, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. The deal eliminates New York as a potential option this season for Aaron Rodgers.

title: Sources: Pitino set to leave Lobos for Xavier job
content: Xavier is expected to hire New Mexico's Richard Pitino as its next head coach, sources told ESPN on Tuesday night.

title: Horschel's clutch putt lifts Atlanta to TGL title
content: Billy Horschel made an 18-foot birdie putt down the slope and Patrick Cantlay clinched it with another clutch chip as the Atlanta Drive won the inaugural TGL title.

title: Sources: Diggs, Pats agree on 3-year, $69M deal
content: Stefon Diggs and the New England Patriots reached an agreement on a three-year, $69 million deal that includes $26 million guaranteed.

title: Dodgers to visit White House, call it 'great honor'
content: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said the team accepted an invitation to the White House on April 7, calling it "a great honor for all of us"

title: Bedlam 2.0: Gundy suggests OSU-OU spring fling
content: Oklahoma State's Mike Gundy said he'd prefer having two spring practices against rival Oklahoma -- one in Norman, one in Stillwater -- instead of an intrasquad game.

title: Heat cruise to a win over Warriors in Butler's return to Miami
content: With Jimmy Butler back in the building, the Miami Heat handled the Golden State Warriors to get the win.

title: Who are the toughest first-round opponents for the Capitals, Jets?
content: The conference leaders meet Tuesday; what do their postseason paths look like? Plus, full playoff projections.

title: MLB season mega-preview: Power Rankings, playoff odds and everything you need for all 30 teams
content: Whether your team enters Opening Day as a favorite or hoping to be 2025's big surprise, we've got you covered.

title: Tannenbaum plays GM for every NFL team in Round 1: Should the Giants still take a QB at No. 3?
content: Mike Tannenbaum puts his GM hat on and makes his own first-round selections. See why he's taking Cam Ward and Ashton Jeanty early.

title: Predicting the women's Sweet 16: The case for and against every team to reach the regional final
content: Why might every Sweet 16 team win its regional semifinal matchup in Birmingham and Spokane? We predict the winners.

title: Watkins' devastating injury shakes up women's NCAA tournament landscape
content: JuJu Watkins' torn ACL changes the 2025 women's title race, and the effects could linger into next season.

title: Pain Index: Whose 2025 NCAA tournament loss hurt most?
content: Some losses are understandable; others will haunt us forever. Let's break down the 2025 men's NCAA tournament defeats.

title: Shambolic Brazil shown up by bitter rivals Argentina
content: Outpassed, outfought and thoroughly outcoached, Brazil plunges to new lows in humiliating 4-1 loss to bitter rivals Argentina on Tuesday.

title: WNBA mock draft: Where does USC's Iriafen land after No. 1 Bueckers?
content: Azzi Fudd is returning to UConn, but Kiki Iriafen, Hailey Van Lith and Georgia Amoore have upped their stock ahead of April's WNBA draft.

title: 'There are no final victories': Harry Edwards is still fighting the good fight
content: Though slowed by terminal cancer, the acclaimed sociologist and athlete activist remains a vital resource.

title: Champions Argentina qualify for 2026 World Cup
content: Argentina will get the chance to defend its World Cup title in 2026 after becoming the first South American team to qualify for the tournament in the United States, Canada and Mexico next year.

title: Brazil humiliated by Argentina in 4-1 WCQ defeat
content: Argentina celebrated their 2026 World Cup berth with a decisive 4-1 victory over Brazil in Tuesday's South American qualifier.

title: USWNT: Rodman back for first time since Olympics
content: Forward Trinity Rodman will return to the United States women's national team for the first time since its Olympic gold medal victory in August.

title: GÃ¼ler, Szoboszlai continue feud: 'This guy a joke'
content: Real Madrid star Arda GÃ¼ler called Liverpool's Dominik Szoboszlai "a joke" on Monday after the pair clashed in the UEFA Nations League game between Turkey and Hungary.

title: Iran qualifies for 2026 World Cup, Australia close
content: Iran qualified for the 2026 World Cup after Mehdi Taremi scored twice in a 2-2 draw with Uzbekistan on Tuesday.

title: Inter Miami signs Ecuador striker Obando on loan
content: Inter Miami signed Ecuadorian international Allen Obando from Barcelona AC on loan through the end of the 2025 MLS season, with option to make the transfer permanent in December.

title: Joey Barton found guilty of assaulting his wife
content: Former Premier League player Joey Barton was found guilty Tuesday of assaulting his wife by kicking her in the head at their family home.

title: Balogun returns with hat trick in Monaco friendly
content: United States striker Folarin Balogun has played his first match this year following shoulder surgery.

title: How No. 1 Aaliyah Chavez's decision changes the top 25 recruiting classes
content: No. 1 recruit Aliyah Chavez's commitment boosts Oklahoma from 25th to 15th in the recruiting class rankings.

title: Inside the incredibly high-risk, low-reward LeBron James bet

content: Here's a look at every weight class to determine the best of the best in UFC, Bellator, PFL and beyond.

title: Red Bull's Lawson predicament is a mess of its own making
content: Red Bull had a Sergio PÃ©rez replacement in house. Instead, it chose Liam Lawson, who's underwhelmed in 2025.

title: Everything to know for the 2025 world figure skating championships
content: Will Ilia Malinin continue to dominate? Can an American woman win gold? What to watch at figure skating worlds.

title: Premier League stars are tough, but criticism can hurt them and their loved ones
content: In his latest column, ESPN FC analyst and ex-Man City defender Nedum Onuoha reveals how much attention players pay to all the negative talk about them.

title: France fix issues, reach Nations League finals. Next? World Cup
content: France have belief to go with their talent and, after righting the ship to beat Croatia, can look toward 2026.

title: From Cooper Flagg to Derik Queen: Montverde Academy impacting men's NCAA tournament
content: Last year's Montverde Academy starting five helped their respective teams reach the NCAA tournament this past weekend.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern eye GyÃ¶keres to replace Tel
content: Bayern Munich's striker search could hinge on the permanent departure of Mathys Tel to Tottenham. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Mamata invites British businesses to invest in Bengal
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee invites British businesses to invest in automation, engineering, AI, and green technologies

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 11 LIVE: Rajya Sabha to discuss working of Home Ministry
content: The Rajya Sabha is expected to hold discussions on the working of Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, and the Ministry of Home Affairs

title: Priyanka Gandhi Vadra to visit Wayanad for three days starting March 27
content: Priyanka Gandhi will attend foundation stone-laying ceremony of proposed township at Elstone Estate, Kalpetta, for survivors of Wayanad landslides

title: Minister urges Karnataka Veterinary, Animal and Fisheries Sciences University graduates to participate in rural development
content: Pointing to the losses incurred by farmers due to genetic diseases, the Minister called upon the graduates to help the farmers and the government to address the issue

title: Shetty Institute of Technology in Kalaburagi hosts SIT TECHNOVA 2.0
content: As many as 50 students from six colleges at Bidar, Hubballi, Bagalkot, Vijayapura and Hyderabad participated in the event

title: Former Tamil Nadu MLA Karuppasamy Pandian passes away in Palayamkottai
content: When the AIADMK suffered the split after the demise of MGR in December 1987, Pandian chose to support Jayalalithaa

title: How is an in-house inquiry conducted? | Explained
content: What happens if a judge is accused of judicial misconduct? Why is Justice Yashwant Varma under scrutiny? What has the Chief Justice of the Delhi High Court recommended? Is criminal punishment initiated when a judge is found guilty? Should there be a more transparent process?

title: What is Indiaâs approach to citizens on death row abroad? | Explained
content: What happens when an Indian national gets convicted abroad? Has the Indian government been able to successfully intervene and commute the death sentences of some nationals?

title: Amid Kunal Kamra row, Shiv Sena MP demands ban on comedy platforms promoting hate speech, creating tension
content: Kamra kicked up a major political storm in Maharashtra for taking a jibe at Shiv Sena leader Shinde's political career in his show

title: Gold smuggling case: Actress Ranya Rao has admitted to using hawala channels, argues prosecution
content: According to the prosecution, Rao admitted to using hawala channels to facilitate gold purchases, a claim that strengthens the case against her

title: A.P. to set up two million roof-top solar units in a year
content: The government has set a goal of setting up 10,000 rooftop units in each Assembly constituency under PM Surya Ghar scheme, says Chief Minister Naidu

title: Drinking water woes, drainage and mosquito menace discussed in VMC Council meeting
content: Majority of the 140 proposals discussed in the meeting approved; animal lovers invited for a discussion on dog menace and its possible solutions

title: Donald Trump's Big Move To Change How US Votes, With An India Example
content: Donald Trump said the right of American citizens to have their votes properly counted and tabulated, "without illegal dilution", is vital to determining the rightful winner of an election.

title: Chennai Techie's Wife Called Him "Sex Predator". His "Singapore" Counter
content: A tech entrepreneur, who had accused his estranged wife of harassment amid a bitter divorce and custody battle of their son, has doubled down on his charges.

title: Man Discovers Wife's Affair With Tenant, Buries Him Alive In 7-Foot Pit: Cops
content: Having discovered that his tenant was having an affair with his wife, a man in Haryana's Rohtak took the help of his friends to kidnap him and then bury him alive in a 7-foot deep pit in a field, police said.

title: "Cutting Large Number Of Trees Worse Than Killing Humans": Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court made the observation while rejecting the plea of a man who had chopped down 454 trees in the protected Taj Trapezium Zone.

title: Hundreds Of Gazans Join Protests Against Hamas Rule, Call For End To War
content: Hundreds of Palestinians took to the streets in northern Gaza to take part in the largest anti-Hamas protest since the war with Israel began, calling for an end to the ongoing conflict and demanding that the group step down from power.

title: At $4 Trillion, India's GDP Doubles In Decade, Outpaces World With 105% Rise
content: India has been the fastest growing major economy in the world for the last ten years, with the latest data from the International Monetary Fund or IMF showing a staggering 105 per cent growth in the last decade.

title: 'They Think It's Their Birthright...': Yogi Adityanath On Kunal Kamra Row
content: UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath unleashed multiple attacks on the Congress - including alleging it "used billionaire George Soros' money" to try and influence the 2024 Lok Sabha election" - in an exclusive interview with news agency ANI.

title: Couple Deported To Colombia After 35 Years In US, Leaving Daughters Shocked
content: A couple residing in the United States for 35 years was deported by immigration officials, tearing apart a California family. Gladys Gonzales, 55, and Nelson Gonzalez, 59, were taken into custody in February

title: US Intel Report Finds Iran "Not" Building Nuclear Weapon Despite Losses
content: Tulsi Gabbard, United States Director of National Intelligence (DNI), on Tuesday said that the American intelligence community have assessed that Iran is not actively pursuing a nuclear weapon at the moment.

title: Gavaskar Questions Gambhir Over CT 2025 Reward: "Not A Good Role Model?"
content: The BCCI announced a cash prize of Rs 58 crore for the Champions Trophy-winning squad with the players and head coach Gautam Gambhir getting Rs 3 crore each.

title: Impact, Then Free-Fall: 2 French Air Force Planes Collide, 3 "Unconscious"
content: Two planes of the French air force's acrobatics team "apparently collided" near an air base in northeastern France on Tuesday and three people were found unconscious, officials said.

title: Indian-Origin Jay Bhattacharya Confirmed As Head Of US Health Agency
content: According to the official website of the US Senate, Jay Bhattacharya won the vote 53-47 during the first session of the roll call vote in the 119th Congress.

title: Iyer Remains Stranded At 97* vs GT, Stuns PBKS Teammate With Blunt Message
content: Shreyas Iyer could have gotten his maiden IPL century but Shashank Singh ended up scoring five boundaries off the last over

title: CBI Raids Former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel's Residence
content: CBI swooped down at the residence of Bhupesh Baghel in Raipur and Bhilai, as well as the residential premises of a senior police officer and a close associate of the former chief minister.

title: "Festival Of Rumours": Muhammad Yunus Plays Down Bangladesh Coup Rumours
content: Muhammad Yunus asked the people to look for the source of the rumour whenever they hear any such misleading gossip instead of ignoring them.

title: ATM Withdrawals To Get Costlier From May 1: Check New Charges
content: While the financial transactions get expensive by Rs 2, the non-financial transactions, such as balance inquiries, will cost an extra rupee from May 1.

title: Opinion: Can I Have A 'Non-Sexual' Mascara, Please?
content: Ever tried a blush called 'Orgasm'? Or a mascara that struts its stuff with the moniker, 'Better than Sex'? Sex sells. Brands know that all too well. Even if that means reducing women to mere sex objects.

title: Tender on for expansion of Coimbatore international airport: Minister
content: Though the idea of expansion was made in 2010, the AIADMK regime did not allocate funds until 2018 and had only allocated Rs. 572 crore between 2018 and 2021, says Minister T.R.B. Rajaa

title: BJP could have gained 14 extra seats in 2019 if constituencies had been delimited: Data
content: Delimitation will reinforce two broad political trends â the reduced role of regional parties and the reduced role of the southern States in national politics.

title: India eyes tariff cut on $23 billion of U.S. imports, to shield $66 billion in exports, say sources
content: India considers cutting tariffs on $23 billion of U.S. imports to avoid reciprocal tariffs, aiming to resolve trade standoff

title: SC takes suo motu notice of Allahabad HC order that grabbing girlâs breasts, breaking pyjama string is not attempt to rape
content: The top court case comes a week after Justice Mishra downgraded charges against the accused; hearing scheduled for March 26

title: Jay Shah meets FIFA chief Gianni Infantino
content: ICC chairman Jay Shah meets FIFA president Gianni Infantino to discuss cricketâs global growth and Olympic inclusion

content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister criticises Kunal Kamraâs remark and also accuses Congress of using George Sorosâ money to âinfluenceâ elections in ANI interview

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. regulates parking fees in commercial establishments
content: The policy will come into effect on April 1; under the revised structure, parking will be free for all visitors for the first 30 minutes

title: Flying car takes off: Guntur startup successfully tests pilot-less eVTOL prototype
content: Aircraft can be operated remotely or piloted manually, according to company officials; it can travel up to 40 kilometres at a speed of 100 kmph and reach an altitude of 2,000 feet

title: Yet another step towards unearthing the glorious past of the capital of early Cholas
content: The Tamil Nadu government has worked out plans for deep-sea archaeological excavations between Poompuhar, also known as Kaveripoompattinam, and Nagapattinam, nearly 50 kilometres south. The excavations are expected to offer insights into the glorious past of Poompuhar, which has elaborate mentions in the Sangam literature

title: Karnataka: BJP issues show-cause notice to five leaders
content: The BJP central leadership has cracked the whip on prominent supporters of party State president B.Y. Vijayendra

title: Mar Gregorios installed as new Catholicos of  Jacobite Church
content: Ceremony led by Patriarch of Syriac Orthodox Church Ignatius Aphrem II at the St Maryâs cathedral in Lebanon

title: 10 months after NEET paper leak, NTA yet to fill five new positions
content: Education Officials toldÂ The HinduÂ that not all Joint Director posts were filled, and the recruitment has been delayed

title: India is the safest place for minorities, says Minister George Kurian
content: Minister George Kurian said world knows the plight of Christians and Muslims in China where they are minorities

title: Will fight Bihar polls as INDIA bloc, to have âcollectiveâ decision on CM face, Congress says
content: The decision was made after a three-hour strategy meeting of the partyâs top brass with its Bihar unit leaders at the Indira Gandhi Bhawan headquarters in Delhi

title: Government drops import duty on EV, phone battery components
content: 28 items used in mobile phone battery making also get the benefit; aim is to boost domestic production, says Nirmala Sitharaman; Lok Sabha passes Finance Bill

title: Freebies distributed by States should not be compensated by funds for disaster relief: Amit Shah
content: Disaster Management (Amendment) Bill, 2024 passed by voice vote in the Rajya Sabha; send realistic proposals, the Union Home Minister told States

title: Citizen forums seek change in property tax valuation
content: TDP had opposed the new property tax system introduced by the previous YSRC-led government before elections and had promised to review it if elected. However, they are yet to fulfil this promise

content: Historically, the BCG vaccine has been administered to infants to guard against severe TB infections.Â

title: Plea in HC insists on implementing promise to waive education loans
content: Petitioner says his daughter obtained loan to pursue computer science engineering but could not secure a job

title: Padayatra across 100 villages warns of Rushikulya River drying up
content: Green activists and villagers were demanding abandonment of dam project on Rushikulya river in Odishaâs Ganjam district alleging that it would obstruct natural flow in the river

title: Kashmir Press Club building handed over to J&K Police, Govt. tells Assembly
content: The government said the building, Bungalow No. 9-B at Poloview, Srinagar, was handed over to the Press Club based on verbal directions following an announcement by the then Chief Minister (Mehbooba Mufti) during a Budget session

title: Vivekaâs murder a major case study in crime: Naidu
content: The criminals are intelligent and use various tricks to ensure no evidence is available, the investigating officers have to be more active and smart in their approach, says CM

content: The three-member committee of High Court judges is probing allegations of âsacks of half-burnt currencyâ found after dousing a fire in a storeroom at the Tughlak Crescent residence of Justice Varma

content: HC sets aside special courtâs suo motu order of discharging them on the ground of non-availability of original TVCC report, which was basis for lodging complaintÂ Â

title: Naidu stresses need to promote population growth in State
content: The State could face population decline in the next 7-8 years, unlike the northern States where population is increasing, says CM

title: Guntur Mayorâs resignation accepted
content: Guntur Municipal Corporation Council unanimously approved Kavati Shiva Nag Manohar Naiduâs resignation as Mayor; Sheikh Sajila appointed interim Mayor

title: Tamil Nadu gets more MGNREGS funds than more populous Uttar Pradesh, Centre claims in Lok Sabha
content: MGNREGS data seems to disprove this claim, showing that U.P. leads T.N. in both expenditure and fund release in the current fiscal year; MGNREGS funding is based on demand for work, not State population

title: Meeting deliberates on flood and fire prevention measures
content: It has been decided to set up a coordinating committee with members from HYDRAA, GHMC and Fire department for prevention of fire accidents

title: D.K. Shivakumar says he will take political retirement if he really talked of changing Constitution
content: His remarks came amidst protest by BJP in all Assembly constituencies of the State demanding that he be sacked from the Cabinet

title: Telangana government to appoint fee regulatory committee to monitor private school fees
content: The Minister assured the members of the Assembly that the establishment of integrated residential schools would not lead to the closure of existing schools, as they are aimed at strengthening the government education system

Rajanna submits memorandum to Home Minister; says 
honey-trap attempts were made on him twice
content: The future course of action on the memorandum will be decided on the basis of legal advice: Parameshwara

title: CFA Institute and The Hindu businessline to host webinar on global finance opportunities
content: Session will explain how the CFA program can help build advanced technical expertise, practical skills and a strong ethical foundation

title: India-Singapore to jointly develop Green and Digital Shipping corridor
content: Under the Letter of Intent, both sides will collaborate on maritime digitalisation and decarbonisation projects, including identifying relevant stakeholders who could contribute to the effort, and work towards formalising the partnership

title: Not afraid of âfalseâ cases, says Kakani Govardhan Reddy
content: The YSRCP leader alleges a multi-crore scam by the Alliance parties in the construction of capital city â Amaravati; NDA government gave 59 packages worth over â¹28,210 crore to its eight favourable companies after accepting an 8% bribe from them in the name of mobilisation advance, he alleges

title: Panipat battle a symbol of Maratha bravery, not defeat: CM Fadnavis
content: Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis also informed the House that the State government is constructing a memorial for Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj in Agra

title: Palaniswami meets Amit Shah, sparks buzz on BJP-AIADMK alliance
content: The AIADMK had exited the BJP-led NDA in September 2023, accusing the State BJP leadership of defaming AIADMKâs icons, former Chief Ministers C.N. Annadurai and Jayalalithaa, and criticising its policies.

title: West Bengal BJP leaderâs angry tirades put him in the political spotlight
content: From angry remarks to women protesters to open threats to political opponents, Dilip Ghosh has invited controversy over the past few days

title: Actor Sonu Sood's wife, two others injured in accident
content: The car in which Sonali Sood was travelling with her sister and nephew rammed into a truck from behind on the Wardha Road Viaduct bridge in the city

title: NGT orders further study to save Chevella Banyans, keeps EACâs recommendation at abeyance
content: Prominent among the concerns raised by the petitioners and agreed to by the court, is absence of public hearing which is part of the EIA process

title: Highlights of Trumpâs executive order reshaping US elections, with a mention of India
content: Donald Trump has signed an executive order to overhaul elections in his country, citing 'failure to enforce basic protections.' The order requires states to share voter lists with federal agencies and mandates documentary proof of citizenship for voters. Legal challenges are anticipated based on states' constitutional authority over elections.

title: Haryana yoga teacher buried alive in 7-foot pit over suspected affair
content: Police discovered the body of Jagdeep, a yoga teacher missing for three months, buried in Charkhi Dadri. He was last seen being abducted by four men. The investigation revealed a motive of jealousy and revenge, alleging an affair with the main accused's wife. Two suspects are in custody, but the main suspect remains at large.

title: 'Rahul jaise kuch namune rehne chahiye': Yogi Adityanath's dig at LoP
content: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath launched sharp attacks on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, labeling him a 'namuna' and criticizing his Bharat Jodo Yatra. Adityanath accused the Congress party of hindering India's development and praised PM Modi for achievements like the Ram Mandir construction.

title: Joke row: After Mumbai police notice, Kunal Kamra seeks a weekâs time to appear
content: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra requested Khar police for a one-week extension to appear regarding a defamation FIR over a satirical video about Dy CM Eknath Shinde. Meanwhile, political tensions rise as Kamra faces additional complaints and ongoing security measures at a vandalized hotel linked to his performance.

title: 'Overcrowded dining hall, no ACs': Desai recalls Paris Olympics
content: Harmeet Desai, inspired by the success of 'Gully Boy,' focuses on the present moment in his table tennis career. Despite early challenges in Surat and later gaining high-level coaching in Sweden, his dedication remains strong. Now married and mature, he challenges the notion that sports is only for the wealthy, highlighting India's improved sports infrastructure.

title: Zerodha shares how SEBI cracked one of the 'most bizarre stock fraud case'
content: SEBI has barred former CNBC anchor Hemant Ghai and family from securities markets for 5 years, ordering them to return Rs 6.16 crore plus interest. Ghai misused his influential position to manipulate stock prices with his recommendations, profiting through synchronized trades by family members.

title: Clashes erupt in Jharkhand's Hazaribag over songs played during Mangla Julus
content: A scuffle between two groups during the Ram Navami Mangla Julus procession in Hazaribagh led to mild stone pelting and minor vandalism. Authorities deployed a large police force to control the situation, which was resolved without further escalation.

title: Sensex over 100 points up; Nifty50 above 23,700
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, opened in green on Wednesday. While BSE Sensex went above 78,100, Nifty50 was above 23,700.

title: New UPI rules starting April 1: Hereâs whatâs changing
content: NPCI has announced new UPI security guidelines effective from April 1, 2025, mandating banks and PSPs to use the Mobile Number Revocation List/Digital Intelligence Platform to update databases weekly. The guidelines aim to curb errors caused by inactive mobile numbers and enhance transaction security.

title: Shreyas Iyer is Punjab King!
content: Punjab Kings defeated Gujarat Titans by 11 runs in a high-scoring IPL-2025 match on Tuesday, thanks to Shreyas Iyerâs unbeaten 97 off 42 balls. Key contributions from Shashank Singh and Priyansh Arya helped Punjab post a formidable total of 243/5. Despite a valiant effort by Gujarat, they fell short in the chase.

title: Signal war chat leak: Trump discloses who added Atlantic editor in the group
content: A junior staff member accidentally added Jeffrey Goldberg to a classified Signal group chat discussing US military operations against the Houthis. Trump and national security adviser Mike Waltz assured that no classified information was compromised. The administration plans to limit the use of Signal for sharing sensitive information.

title: US claims to have brokered Black Sea ceasefire with Ukraine, Russia: Whatâs in the deal?
content: Russia and Ukraine agree to halt strikes on energy facilities for 30 days as part of a temporary moratorium. The deal, mediated by the US, aims to ensure safe navigation in the Black Sea amidst ongoing conflicts, with potential to be extended mutually.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk: 'No more loans to...' as DOGE fights loan fraud
content: Elon Musk supports the new SBA policy to prevent fraud involving stolen Social Security numbers, requiring applicantsâ date of birth for direct loans. Measures include halting loans for those under 18 or over 120 years old, addressing past fraudulent cases and improving data integrity in federal loan programs.

title: Kerala Tourismâs new theme song released
content: The four-minute-long theme song is penned by Manoj Kuroor and composed and sung by Sreevalsan J. Menon

title: Jharkhand government pledges action against private schools charging arbitrary fees
content: With multiple legislators expressing concern over the issue in the Assembly, the government promised action on any complaint received at district-school committees

title: Mega job expo in Thrissur on April 26
content: Over 25,000 candidates are expected to take part in the employment fair, in which as many as 200 national and international companies are participating.

title: JNVST 2025 results for Class 6 and 9 admissions at navodaya.gov.in â how to check
content: The Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya Selection Test (JNVST) 2025 results for Class 6 and Class 9 admissions have been released on March 25, 2025. Students can check their results by visiting the official website, navodaya.gov.in. The article provides step-by-step instructions on how to access the results, along with important details regarding the admission process, including document verification and medical examination. Shortlisted candidates must report to their respective JNVs within the designated timeline.

title: Why does Rekha wear sindoor for Amitabh? Hanif Zaveri claims they still care
content: Rekhaâs love for Amitabh Bachchan is one of the most discussed topics in showbiz. It was recently revealed that the actress was invited to his house by Big Bâs wife, Jaya Bachchan, for lunch, where she made it clear in front of Amitabh that he is her husband and that she would not let anyone else have him. This was a turning point in Rekhaâs life, where she reportedly decided to leave Bachchan and get married

title: CBI raids Bhupesh Baghel's residence; former Chhattisgarh CM reacts
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation raided the residences of former Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel, seizing Rs 30 lakh in cash. The raids are linked to an alleged liquor scam that reportedly caused a loss of Rs 2,161 crore to the state exchequer. The Enforcement Directorate previously conducted a similar raid at Baghel's residence.

title: 'Case being handled with significant attention': Belgium govt on Mehul Choksi
content: Belgian authorities are closely tracking fugitive Indian businessman Mehul Choksi's case as he reportedly left Antigua for medical treatment, while retaining his Antiguan citizenship. Reports suggest Choksi is in Antwerp with his wife and may use forged documents to acquire Belgian residency. Indian and Antiguan governments continue to cooperate on the case.

title: Ahmedabad 2036 Olympic bid carries Rs 34k-64k crore tag
content: Ahmedabad and Gandhinagar have proposed hosting the 2036 Summer Olympics, with projected costs ranging from Rs 34,700 cr to Rs 64,000 cr. The plan includes four additional cities: Bhopal, Goa, Mumbai, and Pune. The ambitious budget surpasses that of Paris 2024, but there are possibilities to optimize costs.

title: Cutting large number of trees worse than killing a human being, says Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that cutting a large number of trees is worse than killing a human being, imposing a fine of Rs 1 lakh per tree for illegal felling. The court set a benchmark for penalties in such cases, refusing to reduce the fine for a man who illegally cut down 454 protected trees.

title: Watch: Suspended Odisha MLAs spend night in assembly protesting
content: The Odisha assembly witnessed high drama as 12 suspended Congress MLAs refused to vacate the Well of the House, demanding an inquiry into crimes against women during BJP's rule. Speaker Surama Padhy suspended them for indiscipline. Despite their protests, including playing gongs and chanting, attempts to resolve the issue through an all-party meeting failed.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for March 26, 2025
content: Stock market recommendations: Mehul Kothari from Anand Rathi Shares recommends buying stocks of RBL Bank, FirstCry, and Voltamp Transformers due to bullish signals and strong support levels.

title: Watch: Argentina thrash Brazil 4-1 to qualify for World Cup
content: Argentina secured a spot in the 2026 World Cup with a resounding 4-1 victory over Brazil in Buenos Aires, thanks to goals from Julian Alvarez, Enzo Fernandez, Alexis Mac Allister, and Giuliano Simeone. Bolivia's earlier draw confirmed Argentina's qualification. In other matches, Ecuador remain on track, while Colombia and Venezuela also fight for qualification spots.

title: Donald Trumpâs invitation to Kansas City Chiefs could put Kelce-Swift relation to test
content: The relationship between Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce may face its first challenge with Kelceâs potential invitation to the White House by Donald Trump. Given Swift's strong public opposition to Trump, Kelce's attendance could be a source of tension between the couple.

title: Canada just made getting a PR much more difficult
content: Canadaâs Express Entry system will no longer grant additional points for job offers starting March 25. This change aims to reduce fraud and impacts CRS scores for all candidates, including those currently in the pool. The decision encourages genuine applications and aligns with Canada's 2025-2027 levels plan.

title: Russia, Ukraine agree to truce in Black Sea: US
content: Russia and Ukraine have agreed to halt military actions in the Black Sea and on energy infrastructure after US-mediated talks in Riyadh. The agreement includes safe navigation and a ban on using commercial vessels for military purposes. However, Russia stipulates that the deal will be effective only if Western restrictions on its agricultural sector are lifted, with the US offering concessions on Russian agriculture trade.

title: Govt: 78% judges appointed to HCs from upper castes
content: The law ministry revealed that around 78% of judges appointed to high courts since 2018 were from upper castes, with 5% each from minorities and SC/ST, and 12% from OBC. The government emphasizes the need for social diversity and has requested the judiciary to consider this in judicial appointments.

title: What happens if astronauts run out of oxygen in space?
content: Astronauts depend on oxygen tanks while in space, with backup systems in place to prevent emergencies. In the event of an oxygen supply failure, emergency tanks and portable cylinders provide a temporary solution. Spacecraft and spacesuits are equipped with systems to maintain a safe breathing environment, but prompt action is crucial to ensure astronauts' survival.

title: Not the last Waltz: Trump defends NSA after security breach
content: US President Donald Trump rejected calls to fire National Security Advisor Michael Waltz after a security lapse involving an unsecured app to coordinate military strikes in Yemen. This exposed sensitive discussions about bombings and reimbursement expectations from allies. The incident has sparked criticism and ridicule, especially given past criticism of Hillary Clinton's handling of classified information.

title: Karnataka mantri files honeytrap complaint, puts govt in a spot
content: Five days after claiming in Karnataka assembly that he and other politicians across party lines had been honeytrapped, state cooperation minister K N Rajanna formally submitted a plea with home minister G Parameshwara seeking legal action. However, the HM was evasive on the issue, saying speaker U T Khader's assistance was necessary to initiate any action.

title: With a record 32% hike, Rekha Gupta presents Rs 1L crore budget for Delhi
content: The BJP government in Delhi has presented a Rs 1 lakh crore budget for 2025-26, significantly increasing the allocation for education, transport, and health. Chief Minister Rekha Gupta outlined financial support for women's grants, Ayushman Bharat, and water and sanitation projects, highlighting a focused drive towards infrastructure and social welfare enhancements.

title: Bulldozers halted after HC stay, but crackdown on riot accused continues
content: Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has temporarily paused demolitions linked to riot accused following a Bombay High Court stay, continuing investigations into property irregularities. Authorities focus on verifying legal ownership and unauthorized constructions. Despite the stay, NMC continues cross-checking records to avoid legal missteps, with future actions pending the court's final verdict.

title: US security blunder reveals Trump top team disparaging Europe allies
content: President Trump and US intelligence officials scrambled to contain a scandal following an accidental leak involving air strikes on Yemenâs Houthi rebels. The breach occurred when a journalist was mistakenly added to a group chat on Signal, though no classified information was reportedly divulged.

title: Yoga guru dies of silent heart attack while driving: What exactly happened
content: Dr Pawan Singhal, a well-known veterinarian and dedicated yoga practitioner from Madhya Pradesh, died unexpectedly on Sunday, possibly from a heart attack while heading to his yoga class. Despite his healthy lifestyle, experts suggest that factors such as inadequate sleep and extreme dietary restrictions may have contributed. The incident underscores the importance of balancing yoga with modern medical practices.

title: Canada: India has intent & capability to interfere in polls
content: Canada's security intelligence official has flagged India, along with China, Russia, and Pakistan, as potential interferers in the upcoming Canadian elections on April 28. This comes amidst efforts to rebuild India-Canada relations after tensions rose due to allegations involving a Khalistani separatist's murder.

title: IB officer found dead on rail tracks in Kerala; police probe ordered
content: The family of M Megha, a 24-year-old IB officer found dead on a railway track in Thiruvananthapuram, has filed a complaint seeking an investigation into her death. While police suspect suicide due to a recent breakup, her family maintains she had no reason to be near the tracks. Meghaâs mobile phone will undergo forensic analysis.

title: Trump discloses how journalist ended up in government officials' Signal group
content: President Trump confirmed a staff error added The Atlanticâs Jeffrey Goldberg to a confidential Signal chat about a Yemen strike. Despite calls for resignations, Trump defended national security advisor Mike Waltz, asserting no significant information was compromised, and the Houthi targets were successfully struck.

title: Eye on polls, BNP worries over bid to erase legacy of 1971 war
content: BNP secretary general Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir expressed concerns over efforts to downplay the significance of the 1971 Liberation War, warning that such attempts threaten Bangladesh's independence. Fakhrul highlighted that some groups are trying to erase the war from memory and distort history, emphasizing the need to preserve the nation's historical events for younger generations.

title: Drake Maye gets No. 1 WR: Stefon Diggs immediately improves Patriots' offense
content: Stefon Diggs joins the new England Patriots on a three-year, $69 million contract . he's the best the Patriots have, a competitor and a worthy risk for the team to take . diggs' rehab is on course, and he will be ready for Week 1 .

title: Breaking down strengths and weaknesses of every Way-Too-Early Top 25 team
content: our college football experts break down every team's strength and weakness . the Buckeyes have arguably the top offensive and defensive players returning in college football in wide receiver Jeremiah Smith and safety Caleb Downs .

title: First bets for the men's Sweet 16
content: the Sweet 16 is set in the men's NCAA tournament . there are no true Cinderellas left but there are plenty of compelling matchups . the best bets are accurate as of publication time . despite the best defense in the country, their offense is what should make the difference .

title: NCAA men's hockey roundtable: Teams, players to watch, plus Frozen Four picks
content: ten of the 16 teams are from the two strongest conferences in the country . most of the usual suspects of the past few seasons are here . three no. 3 seeds -- Denver, Quinnipiac and UMass -- have recent national championship banners that show they know what it takes to win it all .

title: Women's Sweet 16 rankings: UConn is No. 1, USC holds tight at No. 4
content: uConn beat south Dakota State in the 2025 women's NCAA tournament . a torn ACL in her right knee is a season-ending injury . americans haven't reached the regionals, but there is plenty of movement in the rankings .

title: âNot even 1% of Rs 858 crore for central pollution plan spentâ
content: Vishwa Mohan is Senior Editor at The Times of India. He writes on environment, climate change, agriculture, water resources and clean energy, tracking policy issues and climate diplomacy. He has been covering Parliament since 2003 to see how politics shaped up domestic policy and Indiaâs position at global platform. Before switching over to explore sustainable development issues, Vishwa had covered internal security and investigative agencies for more than a decade.
